paper_abstract: This paper explores the suitability of dense circulant graphs of degree four for the design of on-chip interconnection networks. Networks based on these graphs reduce the Torus diameter in a factor root 2, which translates into significant performance gains for unicast traffic. In addition, they are clearly superior to Tori when managing collective communications. This paper introduces a new two-dimensional node's labeling of the networks explored which simplifies their analysis and exploitation. In particular, it provides simple and optimal solutions to two important architectural issues: routing and broadcasting. Other implementation issues such as network folding and scalability by using hierarchical networks are also explored in this work.
paper_title: Dense Gaussian networks: Suitable topologies for on-chip multiprocessors
